humanum_full_description_en:
From the " unitary ", " tell " the sound of the original meaning of wine is intense. "Said Wen": "Wine has a strong taste. From you, tell the sound."

" Cool " can generally refer to air and strong taste. Wei Ruan Ji of the Three Kingdoms "Dang a Official Document": "Shen Jiantukuo, benevolence and justice are the same."

" Cool " also means cruel; harsh. "Han Feizi·Xianxue": "Today we are eagerly ploughing the fields and reclaiming the grass, and the people are rich, and the above is cool.

" Cool " also means misery and pain. "Selected Works-Ouyang Jian "Dying Poems"": "Suffering a kind mother's grace, cruelty to destroy the heart and liver." Lu Yanji's Note: "Cool, bitter."

" Cool " also means disaster and hardship. "Book of Jin: Biography of a Filial Friend": "Liu Yinyou Ding is tough, destroying firewood beyond the control."

" Cool " is also used as an adverb to express degree, which is equivalent to extreme; extreme. Qing Nalan Xingde "Linjiang Xian": "Hundred flowers are cold and warm to avoid the east wind. The pity and tenderness are easy to disperse, and the swallow learns to snuggle up."

humanum_full_description:
從「酉」，「告」聲，本義為酒性猛烈。《說文》：「酒厚味也。从酉，告聲。」

　　「酷」可泛指氣、味濃烈。三國魏阮籍〈吊某公文〉：「沈漸荼酷，仁義同違。」

　　「酷」也指殘暴；苛刻。《韓非子‧顯學》：「今上急耕田墾草，以厚民產也，而以上為酷。」

　　「酷」還指悲慘、痛苦。《文選‧歐陽建〈臨終詩〉》：「上負慈母恩，痛酷摧心肝。」呂延濟注：「酷，苦。」

　　「酷」亦表示災難、困苦。《晉書‧孝友傳論》：「劉殷幼丁艱酷，柴毀逾制。」

　　「酷」還用作副詞，表示程度，相當於極；甚。清納蘭性德〈臨江仙〉：「百花冷暖避東風。酷憐嬌易散，燕子學偎紅。」
